title: Greek Heroes
description: Test your knowledge of legendary Greek heroes!

questions.question: How many labors did Hercules have to complete?
questions.explanation: Hercules completed twelve labors as penance, including slaying the Nemean Lion and capturing Cerberus.

questions.question: Who killed Medusa?
questions.explanation: Perseus beheaded Medusa using a mirrored shield to avoid her petrifying gaze.

questions.question: Achilles was invulnerable except for his heel.
questions.explanation: Achilles' mother dipped him in the River Styx, but held him by his heel, leaving it vulnerable.

questions.question: Who defeated the Minotaur in the labyrinth?
questions.explanation: Theseus navigated the labyrinth and killed the Minotaur, using Ariadne's thread to escape.

questions.question: What was Jason searching for with the Argonauts?
questions.explanation: Jason led the Argonauts on a quest to retrieve the Golden Fleece from Colchis.

questions.question: Who took 10 years to return home after the Trojan War?
questions.explanation: Odysseus's journey home to Ithaca took 10 years, facing monsters, gods, and temptations.

questions.question: Hercules is the son of Zeus.
questions.explanation: Hercules (Heracles) is the son of Zeus and the mortal woman Alcmene.

questions.question: Who flew too close to the sun with wax wings?
questions.explanation: Icarus ignored his father Daedalus's warning and flew too close to the sun, melting his wings.
